Article.Abstract: In the present study we investigated the shaping and evolution of the immunodominance of the T cell response during a chronic mycobacterial infection. Using a recombinant bacille Calmette-Guérin expressing a reporter Ag, the Escherichia coli MalE protein, we analyzed the peptide specificity and the cytokine profile of the T cell response to the reporter Ag by ELISPOT. During the early steps of infection, the T cell response was focused on two dominant MalE epitopes and was characterized by a pure IFN-gamma response. Then, in the course of infection the initial IFN-gamma response to these two epitopes shifted to a mixed IFN-gamma/IL-4 response. At the same time, the peptide specificity of the T cell response was broadened to two additional MalE epitopes characterized by a unique IL-4 response resulting in the establishment of a dominant IL-4 response to the MalE protein at 16 wk postinfection. However, this phenomenon did not impair the outcome of a predominant IFN-gamma response upon subsequent MalE recall in vivo performed in the presence of CFA, a Th1-driving adjuvant. These results indicate that the Th2 nature of the immune response established during a chronic infection, which most likely reflects regulatory mechanisms to allow the return to T cell homeostasis, does not shape the Th1/Th2 nature of the memory response.
Article.ArticleTitle: The shift of Th1 to Th2 immunodominance associated with the chronicity of Mycobacterium bovis bacille Calmette-Guérin infection does not affect the memory response.
Article.Affiliations: Unité de Biologie des Régulations Immunitaires and Laboratoire du BCG, Unité de Génétique Mycobactérienne, Institut Pasteur, Paris, France.
Article.ArticleChemicalList: Cytokines;Epitopes, T-Lymphocyte;Escherichia coli Proteins;Histocompatibility Antigens Class II;Immunodominant Epitopes;MalE protein, E coli;Peptides;Periplasmic Binding Proteins;Vaccines, Synthetic;Interferon-gamma
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Animals; Chronic Disease; Cytokines(biosynthesis); Epitope Mapping; Epitopes, T-Lymphocyte(administration & dosage; immunology); Escherichia coli Proteins(administration & dosage; analysis; genetics; immunology); Female; Histocompatibility Antigens Class II(analysis); Immunodominant Epitopes(administration & dosage; immunology); Immunologic Memory; Injections, Intravenous; Interferon-gamma(physiology); Kinetics; Mice; Mice, Inbred BALB C; Mycobacterium bovis(genetics; immunology); Peptides(administration & dosage; analysis; immunology); Periplasmic Binding Proteins(administration & dosage; analysis; genetics; immunology); Spleen(cytology; immunology); Th1 Cells(immunology; metabolism; microbiology); Th2 Cells(immunology; metabolism; microbiology); Tuberculosis(immunology; metabolism; microbiology); Vaccines, Synthetic(administration & dosage; immunology)

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Called MalE protein in manuscript. Also known as Maltodextrin-binding protein.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose(s) of Bacterial Cells in PBS

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed with recombinant BCG cells expressing E. Coli source protein or with WT BCG cells as control.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Cells from either BCG wild-type or rBCG-MalE immunized mice did not produce IFN-g when stimulated with this peptide.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Called MalE protein in manuscript. Also known as Maltodextrin-binding protein.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose(s) of Bacterial Cells in PBS

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed with recombinant BCG cells expressing E. Coli source protein or with WT BCG cells as control.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Cells from either BCG wild-type or rBCG-MalE immunized mice did not produce IFN-g when stimulated with this peptide.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Called MalE protein in manuscript. Also known as Maltodextrin-binding protein.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed with recombinant BCG cells expressing E. Coli source protein (rBCG-MalE) followed by a s.c. boost with purified MalE in either CFA or IFA 12 wks later.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peptide specific IL-4 secreting cells are seen upon boosting rBCG-malE immunized mice with MalE in conjunction with IFA but not with CFA. IFN-g secreting cells are observed with the use of either adjuvant. Mice boosted with the source protein in CFA produce a Th1 type memory response while those receiving IFA produce a mixed Th1/Th2 response, demonstrating that the memory cells do not follow the effector cell drift from a Th1 type to a Th2 type.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed with recombinant BCG cells expressing E. Coli source protein (rBCG-MalE).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Depletion of CD4+ cells abolished the production of IFNg, while depletion of CD8+ cells did not. The epitope was also shown to induce IFN-g release by the total splenocyte population.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed with recombinant BCG cells expressing E. Coli source protein (rBCGMalE).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: An IL-2 dependent CTLL line proliferated in response to culture supernatants from an epitope specific T-cell hybridoma, thus IL-2 was being produced by the hybridoma.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed with recombinant BCG cells expressing E. Coli source protein (rBCG-MalE).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: IFN-g releasing cells reach a peak at 4 weeks post immunization and then stabilize. IL-4 releasing cells are not present at 4 weeks post immunization, but reach a peak at week 16. IL-2 release is observed at 4 and 8 weeks post infection.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Called MalE protein in manuscript. Also known as Maltodextrin-binding protein.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed with recombinant BCG cells expressing E. Coli source protein (rBCG-MalE).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: IFN-g releasing cells reach a peak at 4 weeks post immunization and then stabilize. IL-4 releasing cells are not present at 4 weeks post immunization, but reach a peak at week 16. IL-2 release is observed at 4 and 8 weeks post infection.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed with recombinant BCG cells expressing E. Coli source protein (rBCGMalE).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: An IL-2 dependent CTLL line did not proliferate in response to culture supernatants from an epitope specific T-cell hybridoma, thus no IL-2 was being produced by the hybridoma.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed with recombinant BCG cells expressing E. Coli source protein (rBCG-MalE) followed by a s.c. boost with purified MalE in either CFA or IFA 12 wks later.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peptide specific IL-4 secreting cells are seen upon boosting rBCG-malE immunized mice with MalE in conjunction with IFA but not with CFA. IFN-g secreting cells are observed with the use of either adjuvant. Mice boosted with the source protein in CFA produce a Th1 type memory response while those receiving IFA produce a mixed Th1/Th2 response, demonstrating that the memory cells do not follow the effector cell drift from a Th1 type to a Th2 type.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed with recombinant BCG cells expressing E. Coli source protein (rBCG-MalE).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Depletion of CD4+ cells abolished the production of IFNg, while depletion of CD8+ cells did not. The epitope was also shown to induce IFN-g release by the total splenocyte population.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Called MalE protein in manuscript. Also known as Maltodextrin-binding protein.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose(s) of Bacterial Cells in PBS

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed with recombinant BCG cells expressing E. Coli source protein (rBCGMalE).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: An IL-2 dependent CTLL line did not proliferate in response to culture supernatants from an epitope specific T-cell hybridoma, thus no IL-2 was being produced by the hybridoma.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed with recombinant BCG cells expressing E. Coli source protein (rBCG-MalE) followed by a s.c. boost with purified MalE in either CFA or IFA 12 wks later.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peptide specific IL-4 secreting cells are seen upon boosting with MalE administered with IFA but not with CFA, while IFN-g secreting cells are seen with both adjuvants.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed with recombinant BCG cells expressing E. Coli source protein (rBCG-MalE).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: IL-4 releasing cells are not present at 4 weeks post immunization, but reach a peak at week 16. IL-2 production is observed at weeks 4 and 8 post immunization while IFN-g is absent. Boosting with purified MalE in CFA produces a memory Th1 response while boosting with IFA produces a mixed Th1/Th2 memory response, demonstrating that memory cells do not follow the effector cell drift from a Th1 type to a Th2 type.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed with purified MalE and 10 days later draining lymph node cells were extracted.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Proliferation was observed after a 4 day incubation with antigen.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Called MalE protein in manuscript. Also known as Maltodextrin-binding protein.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed with recombinant BCG cells expressing E. Coli source protein (rBCG-MalE) followed by a s.c. boost with purified MalE in either CFA or IFA 12 wks later.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peptide specific IL-4 secreting cells are seen upon boosting with MalE administered with IFA but not with CFA, while IFN-g secreting cells are seen with both adjuvants.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed with recombinant BCG cells expressing E. Coli source protein (rBCG-MalE).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: IL-4 releasing cells are not present at 4 weeks post immunization, but reach a peak at week 16. IL-2 production is observed at weeks 4 and 8 post immunization while IFN-g is absent. Boosting with purified MalE in CFA produces a memory Th1 response while boosting with IFA produces a mixed Th1/Th2 memory response, demonstrating that memory cells do not follow the effector cell drift from a Th1 type to a Th2 type.
